item.title: Heap Exploitation
item.description: The Heap is a data structure that exists to manage dynamic memory allocations. There exists multiple implementations of the heap. Glibc Heap The glibc heap implementation works by exposing various functions that work off of two fundamental ideologies: allocating and freeing memory. When memory is needed, an allocate instruction is used to retrieve a location in memory that data can be stored at. When that data is no longer needed, the programmer can free it back to the heap to be reused for future allocations.
